intro: Niphobolus glaber, commonly known as the smooth niphobolus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers with two lips, often in shades of violet or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to regions of Southeast Asia. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
